In heat stress, a NOX-dependent transient ROS rise is an early event ( Königshofer et al., 2008). Then, endogenous ROS are sensed through histidine kinases, and an Arabidopsis heat stress factor (HsfA4a) appears to sense exogenous ROS. As a result, the MAPK signal pathway is activated ( Qu et al., 2013). Moreover, functional decrease in photosynthetic light reaction induces ROS concentration by high electron leakage from the thylakoid membrane ( Hasanuzzaman et al., 2013). In this process, O 2 is the acceptor, generating
O 2 •–
.
